from django.db import models


class ContactSales(models.Model):
    name = models.CharField(max_length=100)
    email = models.EmailField()
    company = models.CharField(max_length=100, blank=True, null=True)
    message = models.TextField()
    created_at = models.DateTimeField(auto_now_add=True)

    def __str__(self):
        return f"Contact Sales Inquiry from {self.name}"


class SupportRequest(models.Model):
    name = models.CharField(max_length=100)
    email = models.EmailField()
    issue = models.TextField()
    created_at = models.DateTimeField(auto_now_add=True)

    def __str__(self):
        return f"{self.name} - {self.email}"

from django.urls import path
from .views import HomePageView, FeaturesPageView, PricingPageView, SupportView, AboutUsPageView

urlpatterns = [
    path('', HomePageView.as_view(), name='home'),
    path('features/', FeaturesPageView.as_view(), name='features'),
    path('pricing/', PricingPageView.as_view(), name='pricing'),
    path('support/', SupportView.as_view(), name='support'),
    path('about/', AboutUsPageView.as_view(), name='about'),
]

from django.contrib import messages
from django.views.generic import TemplateView, FormView
from .forms import ContactForm, SupportForm
from .models import ContactSales, SupportRequest


class HomePageView(TemplateView):
    template_name = 'home.html'


class FeaturesPageView(TemplateView):
    template_name = 'features.html'


class PricingPageView(FormView):
    template_name = 'pricing.html'
    form_class = ContactForm
    success_url = '/pricing/'

    def form_valid(self, form):
        form.save()
        messages.success(self.request, "Thank you for reaching out! We’ll get back to you soon.")
        return super().form_valid(form)

    def get_context_data(self, **kwargs):
        context = super().get_context_data(**kwargs)
        context['previous_requests'] = ContactSales.objects.all()
        return context


class SupportView(FormView):
    template_name = 'support.html'
    form_class = SupportForm
    success_url = '/support/'  # Redirect after form submission

    def form_valid(self, form):
        # Save the form data to the SupportRequest model
        form.save()

        # Display a success message to the user
        messages.success(self.request, "Your support request has been submitted successfully.")

        return super().form_valid(form)

    def get_context_data(self, **kwargs):
        context = super().get_context_data(**kwargs)
        # Retrieve all previous support requests and add them to the context
        context['previous_support_requests'] = SupportRequest.objects.all()
        return context


class AboutUsPageView(TemplateView):
    template_name = 'about.html'

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

1. How do I reset my password?

To reset your password, go to the login page and click on "Forgot Password". Follow the instructions to reset your password via email.

2. How can I update my account information?

To update your account information, log in and navigate to your profile settings. From there, you can edit your details and save the changes.

3. What should I do if I encounter an error?

If you encounter an error, please try refreshing the page. If the problem persists, submit a support request with details of the issue, and our team will assist you.

4. How do I contact customer support?

You can use the support form above to reach out to our support team. Fill in your details, describe your issue, and we'll get back to you as soon as possible.

5. Where can I find documentation on using this service?

Our documentation is available on the Help page, which can be accessed from the main navigation. If you have specific questions, feel free to submit a support request.
